intro: Chiloschista guangdongensis, commonly known as the Guangdong scabious, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountainous regions, and features small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a strong, spicy scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
